questions.question: What does a red octagonal sign mean?
questions.explanation: A red octagonal sign is universally used for stop.

questions.question: What does a yellow diamond sign indicate?
questions.explanation: A yellow diamond sign is used for warning drivers of upcoming road conditions and hazards.

questions.question: What does a green traffic light mean?
questions.explanation: A green traffic light means the driver can proceed if the way is clear.

questions.question: What does a solid yellow line on your side of the road mean?
questions.explanation: A solid yellow line on your side of the road means no passing is allowed.

questions.question: What is the speed limit in a residential area unless otherwise posted?
questions.explanation: The speed limit in a residential area in Vermont is typically 25 mph unless otherwise posted.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way at an intersection where both vehicles arrive at the same time and there are no traffic signals or signs?
questions.explanation: At an intersection with no signals or signs, the vehicle on the right has the right-of-way.

questions.question: Where is it illegal to park?
options: On the shoulder of the road
questions.explanation: Parking in front of a driveway blocks access and is illegal.

questions.question: What should you do if your vehicle starts to hydroplane?
questions.explanation: If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, ease off the gas pedal and steer in the direction you want to go.

questions.question: At what distance should you signal before making a turn?
questions.explanation: Vermont law requires drivers to signal at least 100 feet before making a turn.

questions.question: In what situations is it illegal to use high beam headlights?
questions.explanation: High beam headlights can blind drivers of vehicles ahead of you and should not be used when following another vehicle.
